nodes.documentation:
@dev `error` corresponds to enum Error; `info` corresponds to enum FailureInfo, and `detail` is an arbitrary
contract-specific code that enables us to report opaque error codes from upgradeable contracts.*
nodes.name: Failure

nodes.documentation: @dev use this when reporting a known error from the money market or a non-upgradeable collaborator
nodes.name: fail

nodes.documentation: @dev use this when reporting an opaque error from an upgradeable collaborator contract
nodes.name: failOpaque

nodes.documentation: @dev Multiplies two numbers, returns an error on overflow.
nodes.name: mul

nodes.documentation: @dev Integer division of two numbers, truncating the quotient.
nodes.name: div

nodes.documentation: @dev Subtracts two numbers, returns an error on overflow (i.e. if subtrahend is greater than minuend).
nodes.name: sub

nodes.documentation: @dev Adds two numbers, returns an error on overflow.
nodes.name: add

nodes.documentation: @dev add a and b and then subtract c
nodes.name: addThenSub
getExp

nodes.documentation: @dev Adds two exponentials, returning a new exponential.
nodes.name: addExp

nodes.documentation: @dev Subtracts two exponentials, returning a new exponential.
nodes.name: subExp

nodes.documentation: @dev Multiply an Exp by a scalar, returning a new Exp.
nodes.name: mulScalar

nodes.documentation: @dev Divide an Exp by a scalar, returning a new Exp.
nodes.name: divScalar

nodes.documentation: @dev Divide a scalar by an Exp, returning a new Exp.
nodes.name: divScalarByExp

nodes.documentation: @dev Multiplies two exponentials, returning a new exponential.
nodes.name: mulExp

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256,uint256) pure returns (enum ErrorReporter.Error,struct Exponential.Exp memory)

nodes.name: divExp

nodes.documentation:
@dev Truncates the given exp to a whole number value.
     For example, truncate(Exp{mantissa: 15 * (10**18)}) = 15
nodes.name: truncate

nodes.documentation: @dev Checks if first Exp is less than second Exp.
nodes.name: lessThanExp

nodes.documentation: @dev Checks if left Exp <= right Exp.
nodes.name: lessThanOrEqualExp

nodes.documentation: @dev Checks if first Exp is greater than second Exp.
nodes.name: greaterThanExp

nodes.documentation: @dev returns true if Exp is exactly zero
nodes.name: isZeroExp

nodes.documentation: @notice Do not pay into PriceOracle

@dev `msgSender` is msg.sender; `error` corresponds to enum OracleError; `info` corresponds to enum OracleFailureInfo, and `detail` is an arbitrary
contract-specific code that enables us to report opaque error codes from upgradeable contracts.*
nodes.name: OracleFailure

nodes.documentation:
@dev use this when reporting a known error from the price oracle or a non-upgradeable collaborator
     Using Oracle in name because we already inherit a `fail` function from ErrorReporter.sol via Exponential.sol
nodes.name: failOracle

nodes.documentation: @dev Use this when reporting an error from the money market. Give the money market result as `details`
nodes.name: failOracleWithDetails

assetPrices(address).details: function to get price for an asset

params.asset: Asset for which to get the price

params.asset: Asset for which to get the price

setPrice(address,uint256).details: function to set price for an asset

params.asset: Asset for which to set the price

setPrices(address[],uint256[]).details: function to set prices for a variable number of assets.

params.assets: a list of up to assets for which to set a price. required: 0 < assets.length == requestedPriceMantissas.length
params.requestedPriceMantissas: requested new prices for the assets, scaled by 10**18. required: 0 < assets.length == requestedPriceMantissas.length
